summary: This is an email from Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team to an unspecified recipient, likely prosecutors or prison officials, complaining about conditions at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). It alleges inaccurate information from MDC legal counsel regarding restrictions on Maxwell's movement in her isolation cell, issues with food, and technical problems with discovery materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email; her legal team is complaining about her treatment and conditions while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

events.title: Guards impose movement restrictions on Maxwell
events.description: Guards at MDC instructed Ghislaine Maxwell not to stand on corners of her isolation cell, not to stand to the left or right of the toilet and sink, and not to stand within 2.5 feet of the cell door, threatening disciplinary sanctions for non-compliance.

events.title: Email from MDC legal counsel
events.description: An email from MDC legal counsel stated that no staff member had ever directed Maxwell to remain in a particular location in her cell and that staff understood no such directions should be given.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team alleges MDC legal counsel provided inaccurate information about her treatment.
On December 29, 2020, guards allegedly imposed specific, restrictive movement rules on Maxwell in her isolation cell under threat of sanction.
Maxwell is allegedly not receiving the food designated on the menu.
A discovery disc provided to the defense does not work on the MDC computer, creating an access issue for her legal team.
The email highlights concerns about Maxwell's detention conditions and access to legal materials while she was awaiting trial.
